description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows TCP/IP remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-38063), it is essential to install the latest security updates provided by Microsoft. The critical issue is associated with integer underflow (CWE-191), potentially allowing an unauthenticated attacker to exploit the system without user interaction. 

1. Download and apply the appropriate KB articles from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
    - KB5041571 for Windows 11 Version 24H2
    - KB5041585 for Windows 11 Version 23H2
    - KB5041580 for Windows 10 Version 22H2
    - KB5041592 for Windows 11 Version 21H2

2. Restart your system to ensure that the security updates are applied correctly.

**Details**:
- This update addresses the identified vulnerability, enhancing the overall security posture of affected systems.
- Ensure you are on a supported version of Windows and check build numbers for compatibility: 10.0.26100.1457 (Windows 11 Version 24H2).

**Preconditions**:
- Please verify that you have administrative rights to apply these updates.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with installations.

**Additional Information**:
- For direct links to the update packages, visit:
   - [KB5041571 Update](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571)
   - [KB5041585 Update](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - [KB5041580 Update](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
   - [KB5041592 Update](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)
